Findings.Message: You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
A phone number was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include a phone number.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
We found no work history positions within the past year. A resume should include work history information, including time off, for the most recent year.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
Your resume includes a References section. References should NEVER be included in a resume.
Every section should have a clear, unambiguous, commonly-used header on a separate line directly above the content associated with it.

ResumeMetadata.PlainText:
Portfolio Site:
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
email:
UX/UI DIGITAL DESIGNER	   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  


Over Two Decades of Design & Marketing Experience
As a Senior UX-UI Designer, I take user needs along with business objectives and design them into functional, meaningful,
and accessible digital experiences on desktop, tablet, and mobile touch-points. I strive to provide quality, value, and
results for business projects.

Here is what I do: Software Used:

• Digital design for print, email marketing, websites, and software.   • Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator,
• Collaborate with stakeholders and various team members in a	InDesign
cross-functional capacity.
• Sketch & InVision
• Co-strategize ideation to implementation for the project scope.
•
• Take a user-centered approach by defining the user needs.	Webflow (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
• Wireframe responsive user flows (low-fidelity).	• Axure
• Track the project journey with detailed annotations as it evolves.   • Jira / Confluence
• Align with (or create) the brand style guide and design system
• Zeplin
for consistency.
• Progress the established user flows into responsive high-fidelity
prototype designs.	Experience & Best Practices:
• Strive to uphold and enhance the brand while keeping	• Inclusive Website Design Principles
brand consistency.
• Accessibility (WCAG) Website Design
• User test & iterate prototypes into optimal user experiences.
• Atomic Design Theory Practices
• Constant and rigorously testing of the UX-UI for passable
• Website Graphics Optimization
accessibility guidelines (WCAG compliance).
• Typography Theory & Best Practices
• Engage with Dev teams to review and provide UX-UI
for development.	• Hierarchical Design
• Follow development progress (Jira/Scrum) to completion	• Information Architecture
with QA for deployment.	• Iconography & Glyph Design
• Create or co-manage and help evolve/enhance the brand	• Wireframes with Low/High Prototyping
design system.	• Responsive, Fluid & Fixed Design
• Bring a POV and feedback to creative review meetings for	• User Theory & Psychology Fundamentals
project visibility.	• Agile/Scrum Team Project Development

Recommendations:

"Mike is highly collaborative with not only his immediate team but also cross-functional partners. He provided great
value to the team and was flexible in an ever-changing, agile environment, and turned around changes and updates
quickly and accurately. It was a true pleasure to work with and partner with Mike. His positivity, sense of humor, and
high level of responsibility are a great combination. I hope to have the opportunity to work with him again."
--    ~~~~   | Lifetouch

"Mike's thorough approach to design, excellent communication skills, and high-quality output made him a valued
member of the team and he rapidly settled into a close, collaborative working relationship with our interdisciplinary
team. Michael always kept our customers' needs in mind while working closely with other UX Designers, Product
Managers, and Engineers to help deliver high-quality customer experiences for our consumer website and various
internal tools. Given the opportunity, I would happily work with him again!"
--    ~~~~   | Best Buy
